author: cbs8
title: The Chinese Automotive Connected Services Market - Reportlinker Review
text:
Reportlinker
NEW YORK , Oct. 20, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Chinese Automotive Connected Services Market : Smartphone Applications are Emerging Strongly in the Chinese Telematics Market
This research service provides a strategic overview and analysis of the automotive connected services market in China . It examines the market trends and challenges, and provides forecasts for the period 2014–2020. It offers a brief market overview and discusses market drivers and restraints. It provides a detailed market share and competitive analysis, and profiles of OEMs in China , as well as a future outlook.
Key Questions this Study will Answer
- How is the Chinese automotive connected services expected to change toward 2020?
- Which are the top OEM participants in the market and how are the trends changing?
- What are the key factors driving the changes in the market?
- How will the connected services market develop in China ?
- How will automotive connected services systems evolve over the coming years to match market demands?
Executive Summary-Key Findings
Automotive Connected Services Market: Key Findings, China , 2014–2020
By 2020, ~ million vehicles would have been fitted with original equipment (OE) telematics, up from ~ million units in 2014. Three types of packages are offered in the Chinese Connected Services market: free trial, renewal subscriptions, and unlimited utilization.
The market drivers include: positive economic growth, infrastructure development and urbanization, smartphone subscriber expansion, and real-time traffic data.
Until 2020, the C-compact vehicle segment is expected to dominate the OE fit telematics market, followed by the SUV vehicle segment.
SAIC Roewe is the leading native brand. Native OEMs compete in the low-cost, economy segment, whereas international OEMs compete in the premium segment and offer more years of free trial services (Lexus G-Book and Nissan Infiniti Connection, for instance, offer years of free trial)
The Beidou Navigation Satellite System is expected to lead and guide independent innovation in China's automotive connected services market. It is projected to achieve approximately % global navigation satellite market share by 2020.
